alert.note: Alert for Adams; Clark; Jackson; Juneau; Monroe (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 20 at 2:07AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern La Crosse, southeastern Clark, southeastern Jackson, northwestern Juneau, Adams and Monroe Counties through 300 AM CDT... At 207 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fort Mc Coy, or 8 miles northwest of Tomah, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Tomah around 215 AM CDT. New Rome around 245 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include New Miner, Shamrock, The Black River Correctional Center, Highways 13 And 21, Potters Flowage, County Roads G And O, Rockland, County Roads G And M, Jellystone Park Near Warrens and Highway 13 And County E. This includes the following highways... Interstate 94 between mile markers 120 and 147. Interstate 90/94 between mile markers 46 and 64. Interstate 90 in Wisconsin between mile markers 16 and 45. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
